body_html:
I think calling tf.squeeze() sounds like an excellent approach. You can call tf.reshape() on the resulting Hessian if you need it to be a different shape.

Note that this also lets you compute the Hessian for your original full matrix. Just flatten x by tf.reshape(x (-1,)).
body_text:
I think calling tf.squeeze() sounds like an excellent approach. You can call tf.reshape() on the resulting Hessian if you need it to be a different shape.
Note that this also lets you compute the Hessian for your original full matrix. Just flatten x by tf.reshape(x (-1,)).
body:
I think calling tf.squeeze() sounds like an excellent approach. You can call tf.reshape() on the resulting Hessian if you need it to be a different shape.

Note that this also lets you compute the Hessian for your original full matrix. Just flatten x by tf.reshape(x (-1,)).
